reviews.review_msg: Derek is an amazing professor who seems to genuinely care about his students.

Genuinely one of the nicest people I've ever met in an academic sense. The course was a practical overview of the major topics in the subject area and was quite good. Cannot recommend strongly enough.

Derek is awesome! He cares about his students and goes above and beyond to ensure students success. He also gives advice on joining the work force which he doesn't have to do. Plus he explains concepts really well. Great prof!

Understand that if you take stats with Derek, and you still end up saying stats is hard, it will be WAY MORE complicatedconfusing if you take it with any other stats prof.  Even at a 400 level course, he teaches using simple language and relatable examples.  The tip is to learn from his PowerPoint slides and lectures rather than from the textbook

I've had Harsha before and he was fine, but 430 was poorly done for an online class. Basically read the textbook word for word while screen-sharing it. Didn't breakdown the material or add anything helpful. Felt like I was listening to the textbook on Audible. I spent more time memorizing details than learning the reasons behind certain designs.

Basically does a bad read-aloud of the textbook for material. Runs the course in a pretty obtuse way where the bulk of your time will be spent working through menial mechanics of experimental design. Seems allergic to technology. Pretty terrible, especially when compared with other profs.

Very light class.  The only work done in this class consists of preparatory assignments for the two midterms and the final.  Be sure you know how to get your sum of squares by deriving them from the models.

Good improvement in teaching,lecture notes. Good use of microphone and overhead (which he never used before). Good to see that he was willing to provide so many extra office hours, which is rarely seen in the Stat Dept! However, it would be even better if the lecture notes were more organized. Sometimes they were a bit hard to follow.

Lots unexplained math "myth" in his lecture. Tutorial and lecture are totally unrelated. Exam is like everyone can do 60% of the very easy question, only a few of us can figure out the rest. That means almost everyone got average.
